Dear Ms. Ahart:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 8/31/2021.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and ISEP
requirements, a written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations
of any licensing rules are also violations of the ISEP and your contract. The corrective
action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or ISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 An explanation why previous corrective action plans have not
obtained and maintained compliance for rules found in repeat
noncompliance.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.
P.O. BOX 30650  LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov  (517) 335-1980

questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (248) 860-0787.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12202 Policy and procedures.
(1) An agency shall have and follow written policies and
procedures for all of the following:
(g) Orientation and training.
The agency requires its youth advocate staff to completed 15
hours of training annually.
Two of six employee records reviewed where the employee
was identified as a youth advocate and youth advocate
supervisor, the record showed the employee had only four and
seven training hours respectively.
R 400.12509 Independent living record.
(3) The case record shall contain all of the following information
and documentation, which shall be recorded within 30 calendar
days after placement in independent living and updated at least
once every 90 calendar days:
(o) Service plans as required in R 400.12419 and R
400.12420. If the youth has biological children, the service plan
must address the living arrangement for the child or children,
visitation/parenting time with the youth's biological children or a
clear explanation why this is not possible or appropriate.
In one of six updated service plans reviewed, a youth’s
12/29/2020-3/28/2021 updated service plan was completed
three days late on 3/31/2021.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an ISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional ISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The facility
is in compliance will all additional ISEP requirements except for the following:
None.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHS Contract violation. Please note
that there are additional DHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be
included in section 1. The facility is in compliance will all additional DHS
Contract/Policy requirements except for the following:

722-6B Family Team Meeting.
FTMs should include child welfare staff, parents, caretakers,
foster parents, children, youth, and may also include extended
family, friends, neighbors, community-based service providers,
community representatives, tribal representatives, for Indian
children, or other professionals involved with the family.
Each meeting must be documented in MiSACWIS using the
FTM hyperlink and all of the appropriate forms must be
completed for each type of meeting.
Certain circumstances, events, and/or stages of case
progression mandate FTMs must occur within the required time
frames as outlined in the following tables…
Case Plan Development/ Reassessment.
Two of three open youth records reviewed showed:
 In one youth’s record a FTM was not documented for the
youth’s 5/2/2021-7/30/2021 updated service plan.
 In a second youth’s record a FTM was not documented
for the youth’s 3/29/2021-6/26/2021 updated service
plan. Additionally, a FTM 1105 form was not documented
for a reported 12/22/2020 and 3/25/2021 FTM.
722-9 Foster Care Updated service plan.
Supervisory Approval:
Review and approve the USP within 14 calendar days of the
Report Date.

5/2/2021-7/30/2021 updated service plan, completed on
7/30/2021, was approved five days late on 8/18/2021.
Contract IL Continuing eligibility criteria.
+.1.1b
Every 90 days, the youth shall be evaluated using the applicable
Casey Life Skill Assessment (CLSA) to determine continued
eligibility/suitability for placement. If the youth lacks sufficient
progress to transition into the general IL, they will be considered
eligible to remain in the ILP program.

Casey Life Skill Assessment due by 4/28/2021 was completed
eight days late on 5/6/2021.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas
Policy 722-8E Action Summary
The agency was apprised the DHS-69 Action Summary shall be consistently
documented within three business days of the youth’s placement change or case
closure.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R400.12504(Supervision(2)(c)
The agency was advised documenting the 24-hour, 7-days a week telephone it
provides the youth onto the mutually agreed youth independent living contracts may
aid it in showing clearer compliance to the rule.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
AND
The agency has submitted two acceptable corrective action plans not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The first corrective action plan related to the agency’s 2020 Renewal Inspection,
where it received one citation. The violation was for Policy-FOM 801 for Dental
Examination. The agency has completed this corrective action plan and remains in
compliance with this policy requirement.
The second corrective action plan related to Special Investigation 2020C0420030
where the agency was found in violation of R400.12208 related to Job description due
to a staff not following the requirements of the job description by not adhering to the
agency’s visitation sign in and sign out procedures, incident report documenting, and
respect and dignity interaction with youth. The agency submitted an acceptable
corrective action plan on 8/12/2020; and it remains in compliance with this corrective
action plan.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or ISEP requirements and/or contract/policy. Upon

receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the facility
continue on a regular license.
